DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Expedited Report Format Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the type of report format for reporting of adverse events.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:A report or observation of one or more adverse events that must be submitted within a specified amount of time due to the severity of one or more of the events._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:A report or observation of one or more adverse events that must be submitted within a specified amount of time due to the severity of one or more of the events.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
A report or observation of one or more adverse events that must be submitted within a specified amount of time due to the severity of one or more of the events.

Property.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/5/12 - Released as part of caAERS v2.0 model cleanup.  jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._A short textual account; having provided a short account._The organization of information according to preset specifications._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A Web application developed for the electronic submission of Expedited Reports to the NCI for serious and/or unexpected Adverse Events, deaths, and other events defined in the NCI Guidelines: Adverse Event Reporting Requirements for NCI Investigational Agents

Concepts.definition: A Web application developed for the electronic submission of Expedited Reports to the NCI for serious and/or unexpected Adverse Events, deaths, and other events defined in the NCI Guidelines: Adverse Event Reporting Requirements for NCI Investigational Agents
